|Title=Knowing how occupational health services work
|Description=Actions in the field (excluding consultations)
|Section=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=2}}
The occupational health physician or the multidisciplinary team he coordinates carries out '''actions directly in the workplace''' in order to, in particular:

*assess occupational risks, if necessary by carrying out analyses or measurements (e.g. noise, chemical substances in atmospheric samples, etc.). To do this, he or she has access to the nature and composition of the chemical products used, as well as to their methods of use;
*advise on the organisation of rescue and emergency services;
*carry out health promotion activities.

question.title: What actions can an occupational health physician or multidisciplinary team carry out in the workplace?

option_a.title: Assess occupational risks and advise on the organisation of rescue and emergency services
option_a.description: This option is partially correct, but does not include health promotion activities

option_b.title: Carry out health promotion activities and advise on the organisation of rescue and emergency services
option_b.description: This option is partially correct, but does not include assessing occupational risks

option_c.title: Assess occupational risks, advise on the organisation of rescue and emergency services, and carry out health promotion activities
option_c.description: This option includes all the correct actions

option_d.title: Carry out health promotion activities and assess occupational risks, but not advise on rescue and emergency services
option_d.description: This option is partially correct, but does not include advising on rescue and emergency services

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the option
